title: [Neuroscience] Study of 1.87M Vets Shows Wide Disparities in Dementia. Among the 13% of participants who were diagnosed with dementia over the course of the 10-year study, the researchers found that rates were markedly higher for Hispanic and Black veterans than they were for whites: 99% and 55% respectively

[Health] Drinking red wine is linked to having lower levels of visceral fat while drinking white wine in moderation might offer its own unique health benefit: denser bones. Furthermore, beer and spirits have more detrimental effects on the waistline and on cardiovascular disease risk than red or white wine.
